In case \\pB is one-block loop, this function seeks potential reductions and populates ReductionInfo.

Returns true if any reductions were identified.

### identifyAdditions() {#a89c20b259de97fcdcbaa8efa7cbe47d3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::NodePtr ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::identifyAdditions (std::list&lt; <a href="#aee4d1f2b9ad271e4b8d3239e11a6668c">Addend</a> &gt; &amp; RealAddends, std::list&lt; <a href="#aee4d1f2b9ad271e4b8d3239e11a6668c">Addend</a> &gt; &amp; ImagAddends, std::optional&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/fastmathflags">FastMathFlags</a> &gt; Flags, <a href="#aa22814a2626c20ff9f393408985f3ed7">NodePtr</a> Accumulator)</>}>

### identifyDeinterleave() {#a8cb65248a30c7879c142e0f739921303}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::NodePtr ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::identifyDeinterleave (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; Real, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; Imag)</>}>
Identifies the Deinterleave operation applied to a vector containing complex numbers.

There are two ways to represent the Deinterleave operation:
<ul>
<li>Using two shufflevectors with even indices for /pReal instruction and odd indices for /pImag instructions (only for fixed-width vectors)</li>
<li>Using two extractvalue instructions applied to <code>vector.deinterleave2</code> intrinsic (for both fixed and scalable vectors)</li>
</ul>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp/#l00393">393</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp">ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp</a>.

### identifyReassocNodes() {#ad5937e4ebf4eb3225c6b3ece71803dd3}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::NodePtr ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::identifyReassocNodes (<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; I, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> &#42; J)</>}>
If the code is compiled with -Ofast or expressions have <code>reassoc</code> flag, the order of complex computation operations may be significantly altered, and the real and imaginary parts may not be executed in parallel.

This function takes this into consideration and employs a more general approach to identify complex computations. Initially, it gathers all the addends and multiplicands and then constructs a complex expression from them.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp/#l00382">382</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp">ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp</a>.

When examining a basic block for complex deinterleaving, if it is a simple one-block loop, then the only incoming block is &#39;<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/incoming">Incoming</a>&#39; and the &#39;BackEdge&#39; block is the block itself.

### OldToNewPHI {#a44ad2c7e2af6f19e431bdc2f7a2c6bac}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::map&lt;PHINode &#42;, PHINode &#42;&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp&#125;::ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::OldToNewPHI</>}>
OldToNewPHI maps the original real <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> to a new, double-sized <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a>.

The new <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/phinode">PHINode</a> corresponds to a vector of deinterleaved complex numbers. This mapping is populated during ComplexDeinterleavingOperation::ReductionPHI node replacement. It is then used in the ComplexDeinterleavingOperation::ReductionOperation node replacement process.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp/#l00296">296</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp">ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp</a>.

### RealPHI {#af7602841ce24fa9c4b6dac5f3dac7775}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>PHINode&#42; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp&#125;::ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::RealPHI = nullptr</>}>
In the process of detecting a reduction, we consider a pair of ReductionOP, which we refer to as real and imag (or vice versa), and traverse the use-tree to detect complex operations.

As this is a reduction operation, it will eventually reach RealPHI and ImagPHI, which corresponds to the ReductionOPs that we suspect to be complex. RealPHI and ImagPHI are used by the identifyPHINode method.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp/#l00283">283</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp">ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### ReductionInfo {#aa082061229175790bb77502a904a21ee}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>MapVector&lt;Instruction &#42;, std::pair&lt;PHINode &#42;, Instruction &#42;&gt; &gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp&#125;::ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::ReductionInfo</>}>
ReductionInfo maps from ReductionOp to PHInode and <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/instruction">Instruction</a> OutsideUser as it is shown in the IR:

vector.body: PHInode = phi &lt;vector type&gt; &#91; zeroinitializer, entry &#93;, &#91; ReductionOp, vector.body &#93; ... ReductionOp = fadd i64 ... ... br i1 condition, label vector.body, middle.block

middle.block: OutsideUser = llvm.vector.reduce.fadd(..., ReductionOp)

OutsideUser can be <code>llvm.vector.reduce.fadd</code> or <code>fadd</code> preceding <code>llvm.vector.reduce.fadd</code> when unroll factor isn&#39;t one.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp/#l00275">275</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/codegen/complexdeinterleavingpass-cpp">ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

### RootToNode {#a098ed970ff8db7aee1ddd739158d0442}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>std::map&lt;Instruction &#42;, NodePtr&gt; anonymous&#95;namespace&#123;ComplexDeinterleavingPass.cpp&#125;::ComplexDeinterleavingGraph::RootToNode</>}>
Root instructions are instructions from which complex computation starts.
